what_is_nextjs.title: What is Next.js?
what_is_nextjs.description: Next.js is a React Framework developed by Vercel. It provides the necessary tools to build a complete web application (Full-stack) that pure React doesn't have.

benefits.title: Benefits of Next.js?
benefits.description: Absolute SEO support thanks to Server-Side Rendering (SSR). Extremely fast page loading thanks to automatic image optimization, font optimization, and code splitting.

validation.password_min: Password must be at least 6 characters

module.title: Module Architecture (Feature-First)
module.subtitle: Modern code organization thinking for Next.js projects

what_is_module.title: What is Module in Next.js?
what_is_module.description: It's the thinking of 'packaging' features. A module contains the complete UI, Logic, and API of that feature. It's like a Class in OOP: hiding internal complexity and only exposing what's necessary for external use.

folder_structure.title: Feature Folder Structure
folder_structure.description: Main code is in `src/features/`. Each feature (e.g., `auth`, `cart`) is a separate folder containing `components`, `hooks`, `types`. The `app/` folder only serves as routing and calls modules to display.

workflow.title: Integration Workflow
workflow.description: Standard 3-step process: (1) Write logic in `features/` -> (2) Export necessary things through `index.ts` (Interface) -> (3) Import cleanly into `app/page.tsx`. Helps keep code clean, easy to find, and maintain.
